About the job

Are you a problem solver looking for a hands-on internship position with a market-leading company that will help develop your career and reward you intellectually and professionally?

Analog Devices, Inc. (NASDAQ: ADI) is a global semiconductor leader that bridges the physical and digital worlds to enable breakthroughs at the Intelligent Edge. ADI combines analog, digital, and software technologies into solutions that help drive advancements in digitized factories, mobility, and digital healthcare, combat climate change, and reliably connect humans and the world. With revenue of more than $12 billion in FY23 and approximately 26,000 people globally working alongside 125,000 global customers, ADI ensures today’s innovators stay Ahead of What’s Possible. Learn more at www.analog.com and on LinkedIn and Twitter (X)

At ADI, you will learn from the brightest minds who are here to help you grow and succeed. During your internship, you will make an impact through work on meaningful projects alongside a team of experts. Collaborating with colleagues in an environment of respect and responsibility, you will create connections that will become a part of your professional network.

ADI’s culture values aligned goals, work-life balance, continuous and life-long learning opportunities, and shared rewards. The internship program features various lunch-and-learn topics and social events with other interns and full-time employees.

At ADI, our goal is to develop our interns so they are the first to be considered for full-time roles.

Apply now for the opportunity to grow your career and help innovate ahead of what’s possible.

As a Systems Design Engineer Intern at ADI, you will gain hands-on experience in integrating hardware and software systems, working alongside experienced engineers to co-design, test, and optimize system architectures. You will assist in developing system code using C, C++, and Python, while also contributing to the design of Printed Circuit Boards (PCBs) that support system objectives. This internship will provide valuable exposure to the full lifecycle of system design and optimization, preparing you for a career in systems engineering.

Key Responsibilities:

  • Assist in the co-design of hardware and software systems to optimize system performance.
  • Help develop and test system code in C, C++, and Python under the guidance of senior engineers.
  • Collaborate with hardware and software teams to support system integration and optimization tasks.
  • Participate in PCB design and optimization activities to ensure system reliability and manufacturability.
  • Support troubleshooting and problem-solving efforts to enhance system performance.

Skills You Will Need to be Successful:
  • HW/SW Co-Design: Basic understanding of hardware/software integration and co-design principles.
  • Python (Programming Language): Developing skills in writing and testing Python code for system applications.
  • C (Programming Language): Familiarity with C programming for system design and testing.
  • C++ Programming Language: Introductory knowledge of C++ for developing system-level applications.
  • Printed Circuit Board (PCB) Design: Basic understanding of PCB design, with a focus on system performance.

Minimum Qualifications:
  • Currently pursuing a Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Electrical Engineering, Computer Engineering, or related field.
  • Prior coursework or projects related to hardware/software design and programming.
  • Strong problem-solving and analytical skills.
  • Ability to work effectively in a team-oriented environment.
